description:
For over 30 years, EventsAir has been developing innovative software solutions and services for the event management industry, creating one of the most comprehensive event management platforms that is trusted by event professionals around the world. 

Designed by event planners for event planners, the EventsAir platform gives you the ability to manage your event, conference, meeting or function with ease. From the most important task to the smallest detail, every aspect is covered, including; Communications, Event Websites, Registrations, Travel & Accommodation, Onsite Tools, Mobile Attendee Apps, Speaker, Exhibitor and Sponsor Management, to Budgeting and Reporting. Built on the highly secure and scalable Microsoft Azure cloud-based platform, you have total control of your event anywhere anytime in real time across all devices.

Trevor Gardiner developed EventsAir to empower the event architect in you. “You are equipped with all the tools you will need to manage any event all in one place. Our platform has been designed with a security first methodology and offers PCI compliance plus a GDPR toolkit to assist with setting your data protection regulations”.

EventsAir has been used by professional conference organizers and event planners around the world supporting medium to large scale events including Industry Associations, Corporate Events, Government Conferences, University faculties, plus a range of global events - Olympics, G20, APEC, Rugby World Cup, Commonwealth Games and many more.

funding.raw: The Riverside Company made a private equity investment in EventsAIR on April 1, 2022, to support its international expansion and product development. Trevor Gardiner, EventsAIR's founder, and Matthew Donegan-Ryan, the new CEO, were partners in this investment. The specific amount raised and total funding to date are not disclosed.

recent_news: In 2025, EventsAir focused on significant product innovation and platform enhancements, including a redesigned attendee app, the launch of EventsAir Academy, Attendee Verification, Comms Coach (an AI assistant), an updated Payments ecosystem, a Modern Website Builder, Registration Recovery tools, and an expanded Integration marketplace. These advancements aimed to streamline event management and enhance attendee engagement. The company also hosted its global AirTime 2025 event across North America, Brussels, and Melbourne, previewing future developments like AI-powered features and next-generation registration journeys planned for 2026. While the company engaged globally through its AirTime events, no specific announcements regarding expansion into new geographical markets were found. Information regarding fundraising, leadership changes, or industry awards was not present in the provided results.

primary_pain_points.hypothesis: Charlotte likely needs to move faster on digital initiatives but is constrained by platform or resources
primary_pain_points.van_solution: VAN provides execution capacity and platform expertise to accelerate digital initiatives

primary_pain_points.hypothesis: Laura owns pipeline and revenue targets—any friction in the buyer journey directly impacts their numbers

analysis.why_now: Renee Elliott is first 6 months into their role—the window for new partnerships is open now but closes as they settle into existing vendor relationships. Recent news shows active company momentum (product launches, partnerships)—web presence needs to keep pace with business growth.
